intro: Sersalisia sericea, commonly known as the silky seralisia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its soft, silky hairs that cover its stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Sersalisia sericea is often found in wetlands and marshy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
